content.description: A short but sweet right leaning big fingers crack
content.protection: Friends work best but in BD sizes take 3 #0.5 and 2 #0.75
content.location: Close to winner takes all. 2 minute walk to the right will put you there.

content.description: This is one of the best finger cracks at Indian Creek. Start in a stemming corner for twenty feet then pull some thin moves out of a roof. From there its onto fifty feet of amazing fingerlocks on a slightly overhanging smooth wall. It gets into rattly fingers twenty before the leftward traverse that takes you to the anchors.
content.protection: Two green Aliens/ blue camolots. Three Yellow Aliens/ Grey Camolots. Three to Four Grey Aliens/ Orange Metolius. Three Red Aliens/ Purple Camolots. One Green Camolot
content.location: In the Middle of the wall facing the 211. Hike up or around the colorful pile of dirt leading up the talus on the mid left section of the wall. You cant really see the climb from the road but it should become visible as you hike up the talus.

content.description: A short but fun crack in a right facing corner.  Starts as a layback or tight jams to hands.  A good lead for newbies.
content.protection: One each .75 to 3 Camalots.  Two bolt anchor with slings.
content.location: This route is located on the south face of Disappointment Cliffs about 200-300 meters right of the obvious Unnamed three pitch 5.11 route.  The corner and anchor are visible if approaching from the south side of the crag.

content.description: The route starts as perfect hands and goes to fists (unless you have small hands) through a slight overhang.  Pulling past the bulge into the flaring crack above is probably the crux for most.
content.protection: One #2 Camalot, one #3 Friend, three #3 Camalots and one #3.5 or #4 Camalot.  Two bolt anchor with slings.
content.location: Just right of Angry Inch in the corner.

content.description:
Perfect hand crack for the first half leads to a couple sections of .75s and 1s between good rests. Originally rated 5.12- by Steve Hong, this felt more 5.11, but was definitely the highest quality climb I did on this wall.

Note: The 140' length is only to get to the ground. The climb can be TR'ed on a 70, maybe a 60.
content.protection: Triples .75-2, one .5 and one 3. Optional #5 protects the move off the belay but there's a #1 placement right above it.
content.location: Starts on a ledge about 50' off the ground. Look for the big, right-facing corner.

content.description: Very short, almost horizontal roof that's the best way to get to the base of Thriller.
content.location: Right-facing corner under and to the right of Thriller, the large right facing corner with a hand crack in it.

content.description:
Hard to believe that routes this good can still be had in such a popular place!  Starts in a right facing corner with tight fingers/tips through a bulge to a nice stem rest.  Continue up through a steep fingers and off fingers crux with a few feet out right that keep the grade manageable.  Fun climbing the rest of the way leads to a nice ledge below a big detached flake.

Note:  This route could continue for at least another pitch if it wasn't for the flake but I wouldn't recommend it.  If that flake peels off you and your belayer are F#$ked!
content.protection: doubles .3 to #1 Camalot with a couple #2 friends and about 5 or 6 .5's. A green alien is nice for the start and one each #2 and #3 Camalots might also be useful.
content.location: The farthest right route at the Disappointment Cliffs, about 100m past Communal Rim Job.  Starts just left of a large pillar/block leaning against the wall.

content.description: Easily recognizable for the squeeze chimney that starts fifteen feet off the ground, and isn't exited for the following 30 feet.  Protect the start with a # 3 and a #1 before entering the elbow and knee pressing namesake section of the route. Move out of the chimney into a short section of left facing off width, before another ten feet of left facing off fingers on black rock. Clip the chains out left at a hand jam pod.
content.protection: I single rack from #.3 to #5, with doubles of #.3-#.75.
content.location: Appx. a hundred feet or so to the right of the 5.13- testpiece Dangerous Lesion, at an obvious

content.description: Good hands in a left facing offset to spltter wide hands and a thin finish. Quite enjoyable whatever your name is.
content.protection: 0.3-3.0 camalots. More of the 2-3 inch cams.
content.location: Right of Wolf Dog Shuffle and left of Remote Control. All three routes are a short distance right of Winner Take All.

content.description: A short, wide warmup. Kelley says 1.0-4.0, mostly 3.0, and my partner got seriously Kelley-bagged on this one. It's mostly 5s with one 4.
content.location: On the far-right side of the Disappointment Cliffs (Hong Buttress in Kelley's book). The plaque at the base says Place and Time. Another plaque just to the right says Tatty(?) Gun and marks the climb Time AKA Titty Gun in the new book.

content.description: This route is post "Creek freak edition". Start in a left facing corner with big hands and fists (perhaps just bigger than fist for the small handed folk) up to a rest stance. Now the corner switches aspects to right facing. Starts with hands and quickly pinches down to less than tips and a seam (crux). Once through the crux continue with off fingers and tight hands to a ledge stance and the anchor.
content.location: Just left of the Suspect & Thriller

content.description: Start is brief right facing corner .5 to .75, short bit of broken climbing to a stance underneath the hand crack. Hero hands out the overhang to 3s get you to the base of the stacked blocks. Step onto the stack for a breather before the crux - wicked cool flare climbing with .5s in the back
content.protection:
.5 - 3 C4. Fingers, tips protect the section of hand jamming behind the stacked blocks. Bring a hand size cam to back up the anchor.

As of Nov 2018, the anchor was two girth hitched studs and a small sorta okay stopper. There is nothing wrong with the bolts, if someone were to carry up a couple of real 3/8 anchor set ups (and probably nuts for the studs, can't remember exactly) that would go a long way in restoring this obscure classic.
content.location:
Locate the Hong Buttress. The route is on the left side of the buttress, right of the main gully descending to the canyon floor. The route is striking, even all the way from the parking area.

There isn't much of a trail but the hike up really isn't too bad.

content.description: Start off in the awesome hands to off fists splitter before climbing through a pod and following a #1 crack up right. Bust out left following a horizontal .5 rail (splitter!) before getting to a small ledge and continuing to the top laybacking on .75! RAD
content.protection:
.5 (2), .75 (3), #1 (2), 2, 3, 3.5  optional 6 for pod.

2 bolts at top with quicklinks and biners
content.location: Far left side of disappointment. We approached as for 1st meat and hiked over, this line is a few hundred feet right of the bolt ladder to undone splitter and left of Winner Takes All by 100 feet. Look for the S crack splitter 5 ft left of a gaping left facing corner.

content.description: Fun climb that works through all hand sizes. Starts on a 15' detached pillar. Climb the right side, then place gear above it. Pass a short section of off-fingers in the back of the #4 crack (crux) and continue up hands from there to a section of #3s before the anchor.
content.protection: 1x.5, doubles .75-3, extra 2s if you want them
content.location: Look for a left-facing corner with a pillar at the base.

content.description: crux is half way up on "sporty flakes". awesome and varied thinner climbing after turning a roof 20' up via layback with a face climbing finish!
content.protection:
1-#3 cam

3-#1 cams

2-.75 cams

3-.5 cams

3-.4 cams

1-#6 or #7 nut optional

fixed biners at the anchor!
content.location: route is 100' left of the "Angry Inch" and just 5' left of a long broken .11 off-width climb. start up left facing "crisp and sharp" #1 corner then to face cracks.

content.description: Execute a short boulder move to get above the small cave and begin pushing your digits into the gradually widening #.3 crack. Anchors are on the right after two small roof cruxes.
content.protection: Full rack from a #.3-#3, with triples of #.3-#.75.
content.location: Appx. a hundred feet or so left of the 13- testpiece Dangerous Lesions. A left facing corner above a small cave.

content.description: Start in a splitter hand crack that goes to fist. Then bust the bulge with cupped hands and into hand flake. the flake turns back to splitter and starts thin down to fingers but now in a chimney. Exit the chimney and slab up to the top of the formation to the bolted belay.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the south face and is the next route left of the Communal Rimjob.

content.description:
This route is angry for sure!  Unless your fingers are the size of brats your going to be swimming in this thing.  At least it starts and ends with a nice finger crack and the clipping stance at the anchor is 1st class, none of that desperate anchor clipping crux crap on this route.

Folks with small fingers can probably ringlock there way up this route but I don't think it would change the difficulty.
content.protection: Two .4 Camalots and six .5 Camalots.  Three bolts with slings for an anchor.
content.location: This route is located on the far right side of Disappointment Cliffs past Dangerous Lesion.  Just keep going right until you get to a large right facing corner with a nice hand to fist crack in the corner.  On the left wall will be the Angry Inch, you can't miss it and won't regret the walk.

content.description: This is one of the few routes that I found that had a plaque.  Starts with steep fingers in a right facing corner to splitter ringlocks and thin hands.  About 30' up a block is encountered that forces you out right to a hand crack.  From a stance above the block continue up a flaired left facing corner that goes from thin hands to fingers.  About 8' of choss needs to be climbed to get to the anchor otherwise this would be a 3 star route.
content.protection: 3 each .5 to #1 and a couple .4's and #2's (Camalots).  Two rap hangers for an anchor and a 70m rope is just long enough.
content.location: Hard to say but somewhere to the left of Angery Inch on the southwest side of the cliff.  I would say about 5 to 10 minutes hike to the left of where the wall turns from south to southwest?
